data: `minecraft:behavior.ram_attack` allows the mob to search for a random target and, if a direct path exists between the mob and the target, it will perform a charge. If the attack hits, the target will be knocked back based on the mob's speed.

data.Name: baby_knockback_modifier
data.Description: The modifier to knockback that babies have.

data.Name: cooldown_range
data.Description: Minimum and maximum cooldown time-range (positive, in seconds) between each attempted ram attack.

data.Name: knockback_force
data.Description: The force of the knockback of the ram attack.

data.Name: knockback_height
data.Description: The height of the knockback of the ram attack.

data.Name: min_ram_distance
data.Description: The minimum distance at which the mob can start a ram attack.

data.Name: on_start
data.Description: The event to trigger when attacking

data.Name: pre_ram_sound
data.Description: The sound to play when an entity is about to perform a ram attack.

data.Name: ram_distance
data.Description: The distance at which the mob start to run with ram speed.

data.Name: ram_impact_sound
data.Description: The sound to play when an entity is impacting on a ram attack.

data.Name: ram_speed
data.Description: Sets the entity's speed when charging toward the target.

data.Name: run_speed
data.Description: Sets the entity's speed when running toward the target.
